H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3619.def: = relatively large container ◄ made woven material such as grass or reeds; ► used for storing fruit, but also by hunters to store birds that they have caught

H7019.def: = hot season of the year, opposite of {L:חֹרֶף<SDBH:חֹרֶף>}; ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3619.def: = relatively large container ◄ made woven material such as grass or reeds; ► used for storing fruit, but also by hunters to store birds that they have caught

H7019.def: = hot season of the year, opposite of {L:חֹרֶף<SDBH:חֹרֶף>}; ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7093.def: = state of having reached the terminal point of an event

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1964.def: = a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political

H3213.def: = action by which humans utter a high-pitched cry to give expression to an emotion, which is usually grief or distress, but can also be triumph and glee

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H6297.def: = body of an animal or human that has died or been killed; ► source of pollution and impurity

H2013.def: = action by which humans stop talking

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H7602.def: = process by which humans or animals strain for breath with an open mouth, ◄ caused by exhaustion or pain

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H7673.def: = process by which an activity comes to an end

H6035.def: = state of persons who are suffering and unable to help themselves ◄ because of their own need or status, or the result of someone else's behavior ≈ often used positively of persons who are sincere and not arrogant in their behavior

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4970.def: = reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

H2320.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H7666.def: = causative action or process by which humans or deities cause an object to be broken into two or more pieces; ≈ sometimes use figuratively to denote the sudden end of a certain condition or situation

H7668.def: = causative action or process by which humans or deities cause an object to be broken into two or more pieces; ≈ sometimes use figuratively to denote the sudden end of a certain condition or situation

H7676.def: = the seventh day of the week, which is a day of rest during which the people are not to do any work

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H1250.def: aramaism: = direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

H6994.def: = causative action by which humans reduce the size of an inanimate

H374.def: = a unit of dry measure of which the exact quantity is unknown and ranges between 20 and 40 liters; one ephah equals 10 {L:omer<SDBH:עֹמֶר>}

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

H8255.def: = weight of approximately 11.5 grams, equals 20 {L:gerahs<SDBH:גֵּרָה>} and 2 {L:bekas<SDBH:בֶּקַע>}; 50 shekels make up 1 {L:mina<SDBH:מָנֶה>}; ► used for payment

H5791.def: = process by which something becomes bent or twisted out of shape or position

H4820.def: = action by which humans cause other humans to believe something that is not true; ► the result can be dangerous or destructive to what was once a trusting relationship

H3976.def: = contraption consisting of rod held by a cord in the middle and with pans attached to both ends; ► used for weighing objects; sometimes used figuratively in expressions describing people's status or integrity or the seriousness of a situation in terms of weight

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H1800.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a building or room; ≈ used metaphorically to denote a person's lips with special focus on the lip's ability to shut the mouth

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H5275.def: = a covering for the foot ◄ usually made of leather or wood ► either  open and laced around the foot or ankle with a strap, or closed around the foot like a shoe

H7666.def: = causative action or process by which humans or deities cause an object to be broken into two or more pieces; ≈ sometimes use figuratively to denote the sudden end of a certain condition or situation

H4651.def: literally: what falls; hence: = those parts of the wheat that have no value and are usually thrown away, such as the husks

H1250.def: aramaism: = direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H1347.def: = dense growth of shrubbery or small trees, habitat of animals

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7264.def: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H56.def: = to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H2975.def: = a river ◄ flowing through Egypt from south to north; ► overflowing its banks each year and providing fertility for the fields on both sides; ≈ generally associated with Egypt's power and prosperity

H1644.def: = process by which large bodies of water move back and forth as a result of natural forces

H8248.def: = state in which objects contain a certain amount of moisture

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H8121.def: = celestial body ► that marks day and night and produces warmth and light for the earth

H2821.def: = process by which the light gradually disappears, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars can no longer reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H2282.def: = celebration, usually of a religious nature; ≈ associated with joy

H60.def: = a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

H7015.def: = a sung dirge or lament at the death of a loved one; ◄ death of a friend or family member; ► expression of loss at one's death

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H4975.def: = the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H7144.def: = a hairless patch on the head of an animal or human being in a location where hair normally grows; ≈ this can be a natural phenomenon, as on the head of a vulture, but it can also be created by shaving the head as a sign of mourning

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3173.def: = state in which humans are not part of a larger group or community

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H4751.def: = a small quantity of a liquid

= the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H7458.def: = state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H6772.def: = state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5128.def: = process by which objects move up and down or sideways

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H6828.def: = a mountain, identified with Jebel ʾel-Aqraʿ ◄ in northern Syria, ► known by the Canaanites as the mountain of the gods

H4217.def: literally: the rising  (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3303.def: = state in which the outward appearance of humans, animals, or objects is pleasing to the eye

H1330.def: = young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man

H970.def: = a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength

H6772.def: = state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H819.def: = state of being responsible for an unlawful deed, that was committed either knowingly or unknowingly

H8111.def: = town; ◄ constructed by king {L:Omri<SDBH:עָמְרִי>}; ► capital of northern {L:Israelite<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} kingdom until it was conquered by {L:Assyrians<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}; ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1835.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fifth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and first son of {L:Bilhah<SDBH:בִּלְהָה>}, slave of {L:Rachel<SDBH:רָחֵל>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H884.def: = town; ◄ located in the {L:Negeb<SDBH:נֶגֶב>}, at the southern border of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► used esp. in combination with {L:Dan<SDBH:דָּן>} at the northern border of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} to refer to all Israel

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
